Detailed Description

Internal client implementation of the OPP profile.

Warning;
This is an internal implementation class which must not be used outside APOXI OBEX at all.

It provides an implementation of an OPP (Object Push Pull) profile client based on plain OBEX functionality, hence the OPP profile can be used with all transport implementations regardless whether they support OPP natively or not.

Limitations:

This OPP client implementation supports only one transport connection at a time. Competing requests for initiating OPP operations are therefore queued within the requesting objects which are instances of ObexOppClient and derived classes. At the end of each OPP operation an ObexTriggerMsg is sent out, which initiates a retry of the previously deferred operations.

Concept:

ObexClientOppImpl is a singleton class instantiated when at least one ObexOppClient instance is used. Message handling and notifications execute in the context of the ObexOppClient instance which initiated the respective operation. When no ObexOppClient is active, the ExecutionContext at creation time is 'abused' for message handling.

Member Function Documentation

ObexResult ObexClientOppImpl::Abort (  const WString &  desc,
BOOLEAN  force_sync
) 
 

Cancels an ongoing OPP operation.

Cancelling an OPP operation is much more complex than an OBEX ABORT since it might involve cancelling service discovery, establishmend of a transport connection, disconnecting an OBEX connection or aborting an OBEX operation depending on the state of the OPP operation at the point of time when Abort() is called.

Parameters:
desc Text to be included in the description header of an OBEX ABORT request, when possible.
force_sync When this parameter is set to 'TRUE', any further notifications are suppressed until the current OPP operation has been completed. This is particularly useful during shutdown.

BOOLEAN ObexClientOppImpl::IsValidContext (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Tells whether the current context is valid for handling notifications.

This method must be implemented by derived classes whose instances might be shared by multiple execution contexts to tell whether an event may be processed and notified in the current execution context or not. The default implementation returns 'TRUE', which is appropriate for all implementations which are run in a single execution context.

Reimplemented from ObexClientDispatcher.

ObexResult  result
)  [protected, virtual]

ObexResult ObexClientOppImpl::StartOperation (  ObexOppClient *  opp_client_ptr  ) 
 

Starts executing an OPP client operation.

When ObexClientOppImpl is idle, the operation is initiated immediately, otherwise just nothing happens but the method indicates success. In this case, the operation will be restarted later by means of an ObexTriggerMsg which is received by ObexOppClient instances and tells them to call StartOperation() again.

When an operation was successfully initiated, the OnOppInitiated() method of the corresponding ObexOppClient instance is called.

Parameters:
opp_client_ptr Pointer to the OPP client which wants to start the operation.
